title: How to Connect a New Airpod to a Case

steps.title: Forget your AirPods from Bluetooth Settings in the connected device.
steps.content: Forget your AirPods from Bluetooth Settings in the connected device. Go to Settings > Bluetooth and forget your AirPods on your iPhone, iPad, Android phone/tablet, Mac, or Windows computer. [1] X Research source This ensures that your previous settings for your AirPods aren't saved for your new AirPod.

steps.title: Put both your AirPods inside your case.
steps.content: Put both your AirPods inside your case. Whether you got a new AirPod or case, you'll need to perform the same steps to ensure everything is synced and working correctly. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the case's lid and check the status light, which should flash amber.
steps.content: Open the case's lid and check the status light, which should flash amber. If it's a color other than amber, make sure you don't have anything (like your computer, phone, laptop, or TV) paired with your AirPods. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold the button on the back of the case until the light flashes white.
steps.content: Press and hold the button on the back of the case until the light flashes white. This process also resets your AirPods and your case. [4] X Research source If the light still flashes amber, charge the case for about 20 minutes (connect the case to power and close the lid). After about 20 minutes, try pressing and holding the button on the back of your case again to see if the light flashes white. [5] X Research source Once the light flashes white, your AirPods are synced and ready to use. Your charger will also work as expected after this process. You can then pair them with any device (like an Apple TV, Android, or iPhone ). [6] X Research source
